alert.note: Alert for Allamakee; Clayton (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 09 at 8:04PM CDT until May 14 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Wisconsin...Minnesota... Mississippi River at Guttenberg Dam 10 affecting Clayton and Grant Counties. Mississippi River at McGregor affecting Clayton, Crawford, Allamakee and Grant Counties. Mississippi River at Wabasha affecting Buffalo and Wabasha Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at McGregor. * WHEN...Until Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins, and access to parks near the river in Prairie du Chien is affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 17.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM CDT Tuesday was 17.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Sunday morning and continue falling to 14.5 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.0 feet on 04/27/2008. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1015 AM CDT.
